item.title: There is white gang tag graffiti on the main and side panels of the bus shelter glass, 27th November
item.description:
Please remove *all* the white gang tag graffiti which has been daubed into the front and sides panels of the glass on the Rowley Gardens bus stop on Green Lanes next to Finsbury Park (boundary wooden fence side). Please can it be removed before further gang tags appear - thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Graffiti of a face and the wording ‘Togore-tastic’, 27th November
item.description:
Please can the graffiti be removed from the travel information board attached to the railings opposite the entrance to Harringay Green Lanes station on the pavement on Green Lanes as it is obscuring sign information. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 520, Green Lanes, Harringay, City of London

item.title: Flyposted political poster stuck to the glass on the bus shelter on Green lanes next to the Finsbury Park, Rowley Gardens stop, 27th November
item.description:
There are a number of these political posters which have been stuck onto street infrastructure around Harringay yesterday. Please can these two which has been attached to the bus shelter glass on the pavement on Green lane, Rowley Gardens stop before further posters appear. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)
